refnamediv.refpurpose: Base class for widgets which visualize an adjustment

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Implemented Interfaces
refsect1.para: GtkRange implements AtkImplementorIface, GtkBuildable and GtkOrientable.

refsect1.title: Properties
refsect1.synopsis: "adjustment" GtkAdjustment* : Read / Write / Construct "fill-level" gdouble : Read / Write "inverted" gboolean : Read / Write "lower-stepper-sensitivity" GtkSensitivityType : Read / Write "restrict-to-fill-level" gboolean : Read / Write "show-fill-level" gboolean : Read / Write "update-policy" GtkUpdateType : Read / Write "upper-stepper-sensitivity" GtkSensitivityType : Read / Write

refsect1.title: Style Properties
refsect1.synopsis: "activate-slider" gboolean : Read "arrow-displacement-x" gint : Read "arrow-displacement-y" gint : Read "arrow-scaling" gfloat : Read "slider-width" gint : Read "stepper-size" gint : Read "stepper-spacing" gint : Read "trough-border" gint : Read "trough-side-details" gboolean : Read "trough-under-steppers" gboolean : Read

refsect1.title: Signals
refsect1.synopsis: "adjust-bounds" : Run Last "change-value" : Run Last "move-slider" : Run Last / Action "value-changed" : Run Last

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GtkRange is the common base class for widgets which visualize an adjustment, e.g scales or scrollbars.

Apart from signals for monitoring the parameters of the adjustment, GtkRange provides properties and methods for influencing the sensitivity of the "steppers". It also provides properties and methods for setting a "fill level" on range widgets. See gtk_range_set_fill_level().

refsect2.title: gtk_range_get_fill_level ()
refsect2.para: Gets the current position of the fill level indicator.
Since 2.12

refsect2.title: gtk_range_get_restrict_to_fill_level ()
refsect2.para: Gets whether the range is restricted to the fill level.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if range is restricted to the fill level.

refsect2.para: Since 2.12

refsect2.title: gtk_range_get_show_fill_level ()
refsect2.para: Gets whether the range displays the fill level graphically.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if range shows the fill level.

refsect2.para: Since 2.12

refsect2.title: gtk_range_set_fill_level ()
refsect2.para: Set the new position of the fill level indicator.

The "fill level" is probably best described by its most prominent use case, which is an indicator for the amount of pre-buffering in a streaming media player. In that use case, the value of the range would indicate the current play position, and the fill level would be the position up to which the file/stream has been downloaded.

This amount of prebuffering can be displayed on the range's trough and is themeable separately from the trough. To enable fill level display, use gtk_range_set_show_fill_level(). The range defaults to not showing the fill level.

Additionally, it's possible to restrict the range's slider position to values which are smaller than the fill level. This is controller by gtk_range_set_restrict_to_fill_level() and is by default enabled.

listitem.simpara: the new position of the fill level indicator

refsect2.para: Since 2.12

refsect2.title: gtk_range_set_restrict_to_fill_level ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether the slider is restricted to the fill level. See gtk_range_set_fill_level() for a general description of the fill level concept.

listitem.simpara: Whether the fill level restricts slider movement.

refsect2.para: Since 2.12

refsect2.title: gtk_range_set_show_fill_level ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether a graphical fill level is show on the trough. See gtk_range_set_fill_level() for a general description of the fill level concept.

listitem.simpara: Whether a fill level indicator graphics is shown.

refsect2.para: Since 2.12

refsect2.title: gtk_range_get_adjustment ()
refsect2.para: Get the GtkAdjustment which is the "model" object for GtkRange. See gtk_range_set_adjustment() for details. The return value does not have a reference added, so should not be unreferenced.

refsect2.title: gtk_range_set_update_policy ()
refsect2.para: Sets the update policy for the range. GTK_UPDATE_CONTINUOUS means that anytime the range slider is moved, the range value will change and the value_changed signal will be emitted. GTK_UPDATE_DELAYED means that the value will be updated after a brief timeout where no slider motion occurs, so updates are spaced by a short time rather than continuous. GTK_UPDATE_DISCONTINUOUS means that the value will only be updated when the user releases the button and ends the slider drag operation.

refsect2.title: gtk_range_set_adjustment ()
refsect2.para: Sets the adjustment to be used as the "model" object for this range widget. The adjustment indicates the current range value, the minimum and maximum range values, the step/page increments used for keybindings and scrolling, and the page size. The page size is normally 0 for GtkScale and nonzero for GtkScrollbar, and indicates the size of the visible area of the widget being scrolled. The page size affects the size of the scrollbar slider.

refsect2.title: gtk_range_get_inverted ()
refsect2.para: Gets the value set by gtk_range_set_inverted().

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the range is inverted

refsect2.title: gtk_range_set_inverted ()
refsect2.para: Ranges normally move from lower to higher values as the slider moves from top to bottom or left to right. Inverted ranges have higher values at the top or on the right rather than on the bottom or left.

refsect2.title: gtk_range_get_update_policy ()
refsect2.para: Gets the update policy of range. See gtk_range_set_update_policy().

refsect2.title: gtk_range_get_value ()
refsect2.para: Gets the current value of the range.

refsect2.title: gtk_range_set_increments ()
refsect2.para: Sets the step and page sizes for the range. The step size is used when the user clicks the GtkScrollbar arrows or moves GtkScale via arrow keys. The page size is used for example when moving via Page Up or Page Down keys.

refsect2.title: gtk_range_set_range ()
refsect2.para: Sets the allowable values in the GtkRange, and clamps the range value to be between min and max. (If the range has a non-zero page size, it is clamped between min and max - page-size.)

refsect2.title: gtk_range_set_value ()
refsect2.para: Sets the current value of the range; if the value is outside the minimum or maximum range values, it will be clamped to fit inside them. The range emits the "value-changed" signal if the value changes.

refsect2.title: enum GtkSensitivityType
refsect2.para: Determines how GTK+ handles the sensitivity of stepper arrows at the end of range widgets.

listitem.simpara: The arrow is made insensitive if the thumb is at the end

refsect2.title: gtk_range_set_lower_stepper_sensitivity ()
refsect2.para: Sets the sensitivity policy for the stepper that points to the 'lower' end of the GtkRange's adjustment.
Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_range_get_lower_stepper_sensitivity ()
refsect2.para: Gets the sensitivity policy for the stepper that points to the 'lower' end of the GtkRange's adjustment.
Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_range_set_upper_stepper_sensitivity ()
refsect2.para: Sets the sensitivity policy for the stepper that points to the 'upper' end of the GtkRange's adjustment.
Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_range_get_upper_stepper_sensitivity ()
refsect2.para: Gets the sensitivity policy for the stepper that points to the 'upper' end of the GtkRange's adjustment.
Since 2.10

refsect2.title: The "adjustment" property
refsect2.para: The GtkAdjustment that contains the current value of this range object.

refsect2.title: The "fill-level" property
refsect2.para: The fill level (e.g. prebuffering of a network stream). See gtk_range_set_fill_level().
Default value: 1.79769e+308
Since 2.12

refsect2.title: The "inverted" property
refsect2.para: Invert direction slider moves to increase range value.
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The "lower-stepper-sensitivity" property
refsect2.para: The sensitivity policy for the stepper that points to the adjustment's lower side.
Default value: GTK_SENSITIVITY_AUTO

refsect2.title: The "restrict-to-fill-level" property
refsect2.para: The restrict-to-fill-level property controls whether slider movement is restricted to an upper boundary set by the fill level. See gtk_range_set_restrict_to_fill_level().
Default value: TRUE
Since 2.12

refsect2.title: The "show-fill-level" property
refsect2.para: The show-fill-level property controls whether fill level indicator graphics are displayed on the trough. See gtk_range_set_show_fill_level().
Default value: FALSE
Since 2.12

refsect2.title: The "update-policy" property
refsect2.para: How the range should be updated on the screen.
Default value: GTK_UPDATE_CONTINUOUS

refsect2.title: The "upper-stepper-sensitivity" property
refsect2.para: The sensitivity policy for the stepper that points to the adjustment's upper side.
Default value: GTK_SENSITIVITY_AUTO

refsect2.title: The "activate-slider" style property
refsect2.para: With this option set to TRUE, sliders will be drawn ACTIVE and with shadow IN while they are dragged.
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The "arrow-displacement-x" style property
refsect2.para: How far in the x direction to move the arrow when the button is depressed.
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The "arrow-displacement-y" style property
refsect2.para: How far in the y direction to move the arrow when the button is depressed.
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The "arrow-scaling" style property
refsect2.para: The arrow size proportion relative to the scroll button size.
Allowed values: [0,1]
Default value: 0.5
Since 2.14

refsect2.title: The "slider-width" style property
refsect2.para: Width of scrollbar or scale thumb.
Allowed values: >= 0
Default value: 14

refsect2.title: The "stepper-size" style property
refsect2.para: Length of step buttons at ends.
Allowed values: >= 0
Default value: 14

refsect2.title: The "stepper-spacing" style property
refsect2.para: The spacing between the stepper buttons and thumb. Note that setting this value to anything > 0 will automatically set the trough-under-steppers style property to TRUE as well. Also, stepper-spacing won't have any effect if there are no steppers.
Allowed values: >= 0
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The "trough-border" style property
refsect2.para: Spacing between thumb/steppers and outer trough bevel.
Allowed values: >= 0
Default value: 1

refsect2.title: The "trough-side-details" style property
refsect2.para: When TRUE, the parts of the trough on the two sides of the slider are drawn with different details.
Default value: FALSE
Since 2.10

refsect2.title: The "trough-under-steppers" style property
refsect2.para: Whether to draw the trough across the full length of the range or to exclude the steppers and their spacing. Note that setting the "stepper-spacing" style property to any value > 0 will automatically enable trough-under-steppers too.
Default value: TRUE
Since 2.10

refsect2.title: The "adjust-bounds" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkRange *range, gdouble arg1, gpointer user_data) : Run Last

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "change-value" signal
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean user_function (GtkRange *range, GtkScrollType scroll, gdouble value, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: The ::change-value signal is emitted when a scroll action is performed on a range. It allows an application to determine the type of scroll event that occurred and the resultant new value. The application can handle the event itself and return TRUE to prevent further processing. Or, by returning FALSE, it can pass the event to other handlers until the default GTK+ handler is reached.

The value parameter is unrounded. An application that overrides the ::change-value signal is responsible for clamping the value to the desired number of decimal digits; the default GTK+ handler clamps the value based on range->round_digits.
It is not possible to use delayed update policies in an overridden ::change-value handler.

listitem.simpara: the range that received the signal
the type of scroll action that was performed
the new value resulting from the scroll action
TRUE to prevent other handlers from being invoked for the signal, FALSE to propagate the signal further
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: The "move-slider" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkRange *range, GtkScrollType step, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Action
refsect2.para: Virtual function that moves the slider. Used for keybindings.

listitem.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "value-changed" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkRange *range, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: Emitted when the range value changes.

listitem.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.
